_header: Having a conceit in my simple wit
_description: John Lydgate, ‘De Profundis’ — twenty-one 8-line stanzas (ababbcbc) including envoy

BodLauMis683.First Lines:
Hauyng a conseit in my sympill wytWich of newe ys come to
                    memorye…
BodLauMis683.Last Lines:
…maugre the malys of Infernal dirknessisschal them conveie in
                    to thy regne of glorye
BodLauMis683.Editions:
MacCracken,  Henry Noble,
                        ed.  
             John Lydgate: The Minor Poems, Vol. I: Religious Poems.
EETS
         e.s. 107 (1911; repr. 1961): 77-84 (with st. 20-21 from London,  British Library Harley 2255).

CamJes56.First Lines:
[H]auyng a conceyte in my symple witeWhich of newe is come to
                    mencion…
CamJes56.Last Lines:
…With deprofundis whan þat it be sentAt his chirch to
                    hyng it on the wall

BLHar2255.First Lines:
HAvyng a conceyt in my symple witWhich of newe is come to
                    memorye…
BLHar2255.Last Lines:
…With Deprofundis whan so that it be sentAt his chirche to
                    hang it on the wal
BLHar2255.Attributed Title:
Deprofundis clamam ad te domine / domine exandi vocem meam (f. 40,
                    in rubric)
BLHar2255.Editions:
MacCracken,  Henry Noble,
                        ed.  
             John Lydgate: The Minor Poems, Vol. I: Religious Poems.
EETS
         e.s. 107 (1911; repr. 1961): 83-84 (st. 20-21 only; see 1816-1).
